subject: RE: [junit] JUnit with JDK 1.1.8???
msgSnippet: You might want to try JUnit3.2: http://www.junit.org/junit/download/junit32.zip -- Erik Meade             emeade@objectmentor.com Senior Consultant      Object
messageBody:
You might want to try JUnit3.2:

http://www.junit.org/junit/download/junit32.zip

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org



> -----Original Message-----
> From: bhoran@... [mailto:bhoran@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 09, 2001 5:54 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit with JDK 1.1.8???
>
>
> Yes, believe me, I have a client still using JDK 1.1.8, and they want
> to add test cases to the code with JUnit.
>
> I downloaded JUnit 3.7, and it doesn't seem to be compatible with JDK
> 1.1.8. I just rebuilt JUnit 3.7 for the Text and AWT runners. It
> wasn't fun. Is there a pre-existing .jar file for JUnit 3.7 that is
> JDK 1.1.8 (and Swing 1.0.3) compatible? Try not to laugh.
>
> Thanks,
> Bill
>
>
